articles.title: BTS: Jin to Join Coldplay's Chis Martin to Perform 'The Astronaut' Live in Argentina
articles.description: Coldplay frontman Chris Martin has invited BTS member Jin to play the song with the band during their live performance in Argentina.
articles.content: BTS’ recent concert in Busan will not be the last time group member Kim Seokjin got to perform in front of a live audience before he goes off to enlist in the South Korean military. The eldest member of Bangtan Boys will be performing his soon-to-be-... [1586 chars]

articles.title: BTS Jin to play solo The Astronaut for FIRST time at Coldplay's Argentina LIVE concert| Deets Inside
articles.description: BTS' Jin solo song, The Astronaut was announced, a day after the company said the group is looking forward to carrying out their mandatory military service with oldest member Jin initiating the process by the month's end.

articles.title: UPDATE 2-Argentina grains exchange cuts wheat harvest forecast to 15 mln T

articles.title: Argentina offers a lesson to Britain on how a major economy can implode
articles.description: If Liz Truss had the ambition to leave her mark on Britain, she has succeeded in a very short space of time. But rather than importing a slick Singapore-on-Thames economic model, the prime minister across the water appears to have built Buenos Aires as the promised land on the Embankment.

articles.title: Soccer-Maradona's 1986 World Cup final shirt returns to Argentina
articles.description: Germany's Lothar Matthaeus, who swapped shirts with Maradona, donated the jersey to the Argentine embassy in Madrid in August and it was handed over to the country's football association (AFA) by collector Marcelo Ordas on Wednesday. "I want to thank you, Marcelo, for having brought us this armour.
articles.content: Thirty-six years after Diego Maradona helped Argentina beat Germany to lift the World Cup in Mexico City, the shirt he wore in the game has returned to his homeland. Germany's Lothar Matthaeus, who swapped shirts with Maradona, donated the jersey to ... [1084 chars]

articles.description: Argentina-based Battlefield company Nat4bio makes a food-grade coating to protect fruit from harmful microbes.

articles.title: 'Till' a crushing account of racial injustice
articles.description: Also worth seeing: 'Argentina, 1985' explores aftermath of bloody dictatorship; shocking horror flick 'Significant Other.'
